column2:
The §YCourt Faction§! strives for vassal autonomy and influence.

Their mood is §Gimproved§! by:
- Good relations with members
- Granting a landed title to any member
- Low Crown Authority/Tribal Organization
- Vassal Tax Privileges
- Appointing any member as a councilor
- Holding feasts and tournaments

Their mood is §Rworsened§! by:
- Poor relations with members
- High Crown Authority/Tribal Organization
- High feudal taxes
- Crown Tax Privileges
- Cown Levy Privileges
- High decadence for Muslims
- No member belonging to the liege's council

column2:
The §YGlory Faction§! strives for prestige and the spoils of war.

Their mood is §Gimproved§! by:
- Good relations with members
- Granting a landed title to any member
- Vassal Levy Privileges
- Any member being appointed as Marshal
- The liege having high Prestige
- Winning wars
- Holding tournaments

Their mood is §Rworsened§! by:
- Poor relations with members
- Crown Levy Privileges
- The liege's Marshal not belonging to their faction
- The liege having negative Prestige
- Five or more consecutive years of peace
- Losing wars
- High decadence for Muslims

column2:
The §YProsperity Faction§! strives for wealth and a healthy economy.

Their mood is §Gimproved§! by:
- Good relations with members
- Granting a landed title to any member
- High Crown Authority/Tribal Organization
- Vassal Tax Privileges
- Any member being appointed as Steward
- The liege having high Wealth
- Five or more consecutive years of peace
- Holding summer fairs

Their mood is §Rworsened§! by:
- Poor relations with members
- Low Crown Authority/Tribal Organization
- High taxes, especially for cities
- Crown Tax Privileges
- The liege's Steward not belonging to their faction
- The liege having negative Wealth or being in debt

column2:
The §YTradition Faction§! strives for piety and the supremacy of religion.

Their mood is §Gimproved§! by:
- Good relations with members
- Granting a landed title to any member
- Lifetime Appointment for councillors
- Any member being appointed as Lord Spiritual
- The liege having high Piety
- Declaring holy wars and crusades
- Indulgences and charity

Their mood is §Rworsened§! by:
- Poor relations with members
- High temple taxes
- High decadence for Muslims
- The liege's Lord Spiritual not belonging to their faction
- The liege having negative Piety
- Losing religious wars
- Changing succession laws

column2:
The §YCourt Faction§! strives for offices and honors at court.

Their mood is §Yimproved§! by:
- §GGood relations with leader§!
- §GGood relations with members§!
- §GCouncil positions held by members§!
- §GLifetime Appointment Law§!
- §GHunts and Feasts§!

Their mood is §Yworsened§! by:
- §RBad relations with leader§!
- §RBad relations with members§!
- §RCouncil positions held by non-members§!

If angered, they are likely to back a claimant to the throne.
column3:
Les membres de la §YFaction Courtisane§! s'efforcent d'obtenir des responsabilités et des honneurs à la cour. Leur humeur est §Yaméliorée§! par :
- §GDe bonnes relations avec le dirigeant de faction§!
- §GDe bonnes relations avec les aultres membres§!
- §GDes postes du Conseil tenus par des membres§!
- §GRègle de nomination à vie§!
- §GDes chasses et des banquets§!

Leur humeur est §Yaffectée§! par :
- §RDe mauvaises relations avec le dirigeant de faction§!
- §RDe mauvaises relations avec les aultres membres§!
- §RDes postes du Conseil tenus par des non-membres§!

S'ils sont irrités, ils sont susceptibles de soutenir un prétendant au trosne.
column4: Die Hof-splittergruppe kämpft um Büros und besondere Auszeichnungen am Hofe.

column2:
The §YPrincely Faction§! strives for autonomy and influence for feudal vassal lords.

Their mood is §Yimproved§! by:
- §GGood relations with leader
- §GGood relations with members§!
- §GLow crown authority§!
- §GVassal Tax Privileges
- §GSmall Liege Demesne§!
- §GTournaments§!

Their mood is §Yworsened§! by:
- §RBad relations with leader§!
- §RBad relations with members§!
- §RRegencies§!
- §RHigh Crown Authority§!
- §RCrown Levy Privileges§!
- §RCrown Tax Privileges§!
- §RMedium or High Feudal Taxes§!

If angered, they are likely to demand reduced crown authority or back a claimant to the throne.
column3:
La §YFaction Féodale§! s'efforce d'obtenir plus d'autonomie et d'influence pour les seigneurs féodaulx.

Leur humeur est §Yaméliorée§! par :
- §GDe bonnes relations avec le dirigeant de faction§!
- §GDe bonnes relations avec les aultres membres§!
- §GUne autorité de la couronne faible§!
- §GUne imposition favorable aulx Vassaulx
- §GUn suzerain avec un petit domaine§!
- §GLes tournois§!

Leur humeur est §Yaffectée§! par :
- §RDe mauvaises relations avec le dirigeant de faction§!
- §RDe mauvaises relations avec les aultres membres§!
- §RLes Régences!
- §RUne loi de levée des armées favorable à la Couronne§!
- §RUne imposition favorable à la Couronne§!
- §RUne Taxe Féodale moyenne ou élevée§!
- §RUne haute autorité de la Couronne§!

S'ils sont irrités, ils sont susceptibles de demander une réduction de l'autorité de la couronne ou de soutenir un prétendant au trosne.
column4: Die Fürstliche Splittergruppe kämpft um die Autonomie und den Einfluss für Feudalvasall-Herren.

column2: A claimant to the throne of [This.GetName]. If [New.GetSheHe] gathers enough support from the factions, [New.GetSheHe] will declare war.

column2:
The §YReligious Faction§! serves the interests of the Church.

Their mood is §Yimproved§! by:
- §GGood relations with leader§!
- §GGood relations with members§!
- §GVassal Tax Privileges§!
- §GHigh Piety§!
- §GHoly Wars§!
- §GConverting provinces§!

Their mood is §Yworsened§! by:
- §RBad relations with leader§!
- §RBad relations with members§!
- §RCrown Tax Privileges§!
- §RMedium or High Church Taxes§!
- §RLow Piety§!
- §RExcommunicated liege§!
column3:
Les membres de la §YFaction Religieuse§! servent les intérests de l'Eglise.

Leur humeur est §Yaméliorée§! par :
- §GDe bonnes relations avec le dirigeant de faction§!
- §GDe bonnes relations avec les aultres membres§!
- §GUne piété élevée§!
- §GDes Imposts favorisant les Vassaulx§!
- §GLes Guerres Saintes§!
- §GLa Conversion de Provinces§!

Leur humeur est §Yaffectée§! par :
- §RDe mauvaises relations avec le dirigeant de faction§!
- §RDe mauvaises relations avec les aultres membres§!
- §RUne imposition favorable à la Couronne§!
- §RDes imposts sur l'Eglise de niveau moyen ou élevé§!
- §RUne piété faible§!
- §RUn suzerain excommunié§!
column4: Die Religiöse Splittergruppe dient den Interessen der Kirche.

column2:
The §YRepublican Faction§! looks after the interests of the cities.

Their mood is §Yimproved§! by:
- §GGood relations with leader§!
- §GGood relations with members§!
- §GVassal Tax Privileges§!
- §GSummer Fairs§!

Their mood is §Yworsened§! by:
- §RBad relations with leader§!
- §RBad relations with members§!
- §RCrown Tax Privileges§!
- §RMedium or High City Taxes§!
- §RRegencies§!

If angered, they may attempt to institute republican rule.

column2: Separatists are radicals that cannot be bargained with. They will settle for nothing less than complete independence.
column3: Les séparatistes sont si radicaulx qu'on ne peult point négocier avec eulx. Ils n'accepteront rien de moins que l'indépendance complète.
column4: Separatisten sind Radikale, die man nicht verhandeln werden kann. Sie werden für nichts weniger als vollständige Unabhängigkeit zu begleichen.
column6: Separatists are radicals that cannot be bargained with. They will settle for nothing less than complete independence.

column2: Declare war on [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] for the independence of the Separatist movement.
column3: Déclarer une guerre à [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] pour l'indépendance du mouvement séparatiste.
column4: Krieg an [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] erklären für die Unabhängigkeit der Separatistenbewegung.
column6: Declare war on [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] for the independence of the Separatist movement.
